abstract: Managers of three of the better-performing mutual funds in the first quarter succeeded by buying stocks shunned by others, or by holding investments longer.
snippet: Managers of three of the better-performing mutual funds in the first quarter succeeded by buying stocks shunned by others, or by holding investments longer.
lead_paragraph: MANAGERS of three of the better-performing mutual funds in the first quarter do not mind zigging while others zag. The captains of the Ivy Cundill Global Value fund and the John Hancock Global Opportunities fund seek stocks that others are shunning, while the steward at Fidelity Convertible Securities hangs onto investments far longer than his peers.

headline.main: Finding Big Profits Along the Roads Less Traveled
headline.print_headline: Finding Big Profits Along the Roads Less Traveled
